intro: Habrothamnus schottii, commonly known as the Schott's habrothamnus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
